name: livecc
description: LiveCC: Learning Video LLM with Streaming Speech Transcription at Scale (CVPR 2025)
readme_summary: LiveCC is a video Large Language Model (LLM) designed for real-time commentary generation. It utilizes a novel streaming speech transcription method to process video and generate commentary, achieving state-of-the-art performance on both streaming and offline benchmarks.
key_features: Streaming speech transcription for video LLMs
State-of-the-art performance on streaming and offline benchmarks
primary_use_case: Enabling AI systems to generate real-time commentary for videos by processing video content and its associated audio stream simultaneously.
cover_image_prompt: A dynamic 3D isometric illustration of a futuristic AI conductor orchestrating a symphony of video and audio. The conductor, a sleek, glowing figure, stands at a podium where a video stream flows like a river. From the river, sound waves are extracted and transformed into musical notes that fly towards a large screen displaying real-time commentary. Subtle UI elements showing transcription progress and LLM confidence scores are visible on the podium. The background is a clean, modern studio with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing the seamless integration of video, audio, and AI-generated text. The repository name 'LiveCC' is subtly etched into the conductor's podium.

name: xleak
description: A fast terminal Excel viewer with an interactive TUI. Features full-text search, formula display, lazy loading for large files, clipboard support, and export to CSV/JSON. Built with Rust and ratatui.
readme_summary: xleak is a fast terminal-based Excel viewer built with Rust and ratatui. It provides an interactive TUI for navigating and searching spreadsheet data, supporting various Excel and OpenDocument formats with features like lazy loading for large files and export capabilities.
key_features: Multiple export formats (CSV, JSON, plain text)
primary_use_case: Viewing and interacting with Excel spreadsheets directly in the terminal without needing Microsoft Excel.
cover_image_prompt: A curious librarian in a cozy, dimly lit library, using a magnifying glass to examine a large, old-fashioned ledger book. Instead of ink, the ledger's pages are filled with glowing, organized cells, some displaying numbers, others text, and a few showing intricate formulas. The librarian's magnifying glass highlights a specific cell, revealing its underlying formula on a small, transparent screen projected from the glass. Subtle digital particles flow from the book, hinting at data extraction. The overall mood is one of discovery and efficient data exploration within a traditional setting. The style should be a warm, 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear details and a slightly magical, tech-infused atmosphere.

name: filesql
description: sql driver for CSV, TSV, LTSV, Parquet, Excel with gzip, bzip2, xz, zstd support.
readme_summary: filesql is a Go SQL driver that allows users to query various file formats like CSV, TSV, LTSV, Parquet, and Excel using standard SQLite3 SQL syntax. It supports multiple compression formats and flexible input sources, enabling in-memory data processing without external databases.
key_features: Support for CSV, TSV, LTSV, Parquet, and Excel (XLSX) files
Automatic handling of .gz, .bz2, .xz, .zst, .z, .snappy, .s2, and .lz4 compressed files
Support for file paths, directories, io.Reader, and embed.FS
primary_use_case: Querying and manipulating data within various file formats (CSV, TSV, Parquet, Excel) using SQL syntax directly within Go applications, without requiring a traditional database setup.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old librarian in a bustling, modern library, holding a magnifying glass over a stack of diverse documents (CSV, Parquet, XLSX). As the librarian points the magnifying glass, the documents transform into organized, glowing SQL query results displayed on a floating digital screen. Subtle data streams flow from the documents to the screen, and the library shelves are lined with compressed file icons (like .gz, .zip). The repository name 'filesql' is subtly etched on the librarian's spectacles. The scene is rendered in a warm, inviting 3D isometric illustration style, emphasizing clarity and accessibility.
